Q2:
For this survey, we are defining a “paper laboratory notebook” as a bound, paper notebook with numbered pages in which dated notes on methodology and results of experiments are kept.
Have you used a paper laboratory notebook in a previous laboratory class or research project?
Q1_1: When thinking of using a paper laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Ability to record observations and data
Q1_2: When thinking of using a paper laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Ability to locate previous experimental data/results
Q1_3: When thinking of using a paper laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Access to protocols
Q1_4: When thinking of using a paper laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Ease of producing publication-quality figures
Q1_5: When thinking of using a paper laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Ability to contribute to sustainable practices in the lab
Q1_6: When thinking of using a paper laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Overall ease of use
Q3:
For this survey, we are defining an “electronic laboratory notebook” as a computer-based file system in which dated notes on methodology and results of experiments are kept.
Have you used an electronic laboratory notebook in a previous laboratory class or research project?
Q4_1: When thinking of using an electronic laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Ability to record observations and data
Q4_2: When thinking of using an electronic laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Ability to locate previous experimental data/results
Q4_3: When thinking of using an electronic laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Access to protocols
Q4_4: When thinking of using an electronic laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Ease of producing publication-quality figures
Q4_5: When thinking of using an electronic laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Ability to contribute to sustainable practices in the lab
Q4_6: When thinking of using an electronic laboratory notebook, how easy do you perceive the following to be? - Overall ease of use
Q5: If given a choice, which style of laboratory notebook would you prefer to use?
Q6: Which of the following items do you regularly include in a laboratory notebook entry?
Q7: Which of the following items do you think SHOULD be included in a laboratory notebook entry as "best practice," such as in an industrial setting?
Q8: Thinking of the last time you used a laboratory notebook for class or a research project, how often did you access your laboratory notebook outside of the lab space?
Q14: Do you think using electronic laboratory notebooks in place of paper laboratory notebooks contributes to sustainable practices in the laboratory?
